meanings.definition: The quality or state of being gritty or containing small bits.
meanings.sent1: The bittiness of the sandpaper made it perfect for smoothing rough wood surfaces.
meanings.sent2: I don't like the bittiness of this cereal; it feels like I'm eating tiny rocks.
meanings.sent3: The bittiness of the sugar in my coffee made me feel like I was drinking a sandy beach.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a bittiness to it, like gravel crunching underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The bittiness of the cookie dough added a delightful crunch to each bite.

meanings.definition: The presence of small particles or fragments in a substance.
meanings.sent1: The bittiness of the flour made the cake batter feel rough.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the bittiness of the dirt between my fingers as I planted the seeds.
meanings.sent3: The bittiness of the paint made the wall look like it was covered in confetti.
meanings.sent4: The bittiness of the snow reminded me of powdered sugar sprinkled on a cake.
meanings.sent5: The bittiness of the lotion made it exfoliate my skin as I rubbed it in.
